required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Robotic Assisted Cochlear Implantation Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: Robotic Assisted Cochlear Implantation Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: A first in man clinical trial to asses the the use of am image guided robotic system to safely and effectively create a minimally invasive access tunnel to the middle ear cavity to allow access to the round window for cochlear implant electrode insertion.

detailed_description.textblock: A first in man feasibility study of an image guided robotic system for performing a key-hole approach to the middle ear cavity.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Insufficient enrollment and extended study duration

primary_outcome.time_frame: Image data acquired during the procedure
primary_outcome.description: The lateral distance between the center lines of the planned and drilled tunnel positions at the level of the facial nerve measured from medical image data

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of successfully completed robotic procedures
secondary_outcome.description: The number of procedures drilled robotically to the middle ear cavity

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of successful cochlear implant electrode array insertions
secondary_outcome.description: Number of electrode arrays implanted through the key-hole approach to the middle ear cavity
Fiducial matching error of patient to image registration

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of the robotic procedure and its subparts
secondary_outcome.description: Total time of the robotic procedure from opening to closing (mean and standard deviation) and of the subprocesses
Any clinical complications including facial nerve or chorda tympani damage, infection, negative audiological outcomes etc
Pain scale and prescribed pain medication

arm_group.description: Minimally invasive robotic cochlear implantation with custom device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Geographically and physically able to attend scheduled evaluations and follow-up appointments
- Indicated for cochlear implantation
- Age 18 years or older
- Fluent in German or French
- Sufficient facial recess size ( > 2.5 mm between the facial nerve and chorda tympani)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Anatomical malformation of the middle or inner ear or unusual facial nerve course
- Lack of compliance with any inclusion criteria
